alert.note: Alert for Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 12:53PM CDT until May 11 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN TENSAS AND MADISON PARISHES...WARREN...CLAIBORNE AND SOUTH CENTRAL ISSAQUENA COUNTIES... At 1252 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mansford to near Afton to near Lake Bruin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Eagle Bend around 100 PM CDT. Vicksburg, Le Tourneau and Yokena around 105 PM CDT. Port Gibson around 110 PM CDT. Redwood and Rocky Springs around 115 PM CDT. Hermanville, Bovina, Oak Ridge and Reganton around 120 PM CDT. Flowers around 125 PM CDT. Youngton around 130 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Delta and Richmond. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern and west central Mississippi. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
